programme.title: UEFA Europa League and Conference League Magazine
programme.desc: Jurgen Klinsmann makes a phone call back to his old club, Stuttgart, ahead of their UEFA Europa League campaign. And, we delve into the success of SK Brann.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: We take a special look at Kevin De Bruyne's return to the Etihad Stadium. Manager Juan Carlos Carcedo and defender David Goldar talk about Pafos' journey to the Champions League.

programme.title: Premier League Netbusters
programme.desc: A unique and fast-paced look at all the best action from the Premier League, including Liverpool v Everton, Man United v Chelsea and Arsenal v Man City.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: In this episode, we look back at Yoshida's journey from Japan to England's top-flight, his role as a leader for club and country, and the cultural bridge he helped build along the way. Now in the final stages of his playing career with LA Galaxy in the USA, we catch up with him as he looks to inspire the next generation, both in Japan and around the world.

programme.title: The Gruppetto
programme.desc: Hosted by Rob Hatch, The Gruppetto brings you everything you need to stay up to speed with the world of cycling, from in-depth race reviews to the latest news from the peloton.

programme.desc: Action from the Mixed Time Trial Relay, part of the Cycling World Championship in Kigali, Rwanda.

programme.title: Endurance Uncovered: Racing for Excellence
programme.desc: A special look at the World Endurance Championship, a global series of races that test the limits of both drivers and vehicles.

programme.title: Match Officials Mic'd Up
programme.desc: PGMOL chief Howard Webb reviews the decision-making process for five key incidents in the Premier League, including Josh King's controversial disallowed goal against Chelsea.

programme.title: Ally's Social Club
programme.desc: Mikel Arteta talks to Ally McCoist about playing alongside Xavi, Iniesta and Ronaldinho, his relationship with Pep Guardiola and his vision for Arsenal this season.

programme.title: Premier League Review
programme.desc: A look back at the best of the recent action from matchday five of the Premier League, featuring the Merseyside derby, Man United v Chelsea, and Arsenal v Man City.

programme.desc: Nottingham Forest return to European football for the first time in 30 years as they travel to face Manuel Pellegrini's Real Betis at Estadio Benito Villamarin.

programme.title: Football
programme.desc: This documentary tells the real-life story of Nottingham Forest's extraordinary 1979 European Cup triumph and the colourful exploits of the club's manager, Brian Clough.
